__e: It took me six months to get her to go on a date.
Cost me nearly everything I have left... but she's safe.
But she cost me a lot of money. And she still costs a lot.
My father tried to do the right thing and leave the Circle and it cost him his life.
Your father fought in the war for this country on behalf of, and almost lost his life.
I think whatever he was going to tell me cost him his life.
It took us more than 20 minutes to reach the edge overlooking the courtyard.
That-that piece of dirt-- he cost us the house we were trying to buy.
They cost us I don't know how many men and women.
Well, assuming we are the "right people", what would your idea of "reasonable" be?
I had to jump through hoops all night for Barney and then it took me an hour to get home because his place is so far away from the bar.
And even though it hadn't cost me a dime, it cost me stuff a whole lot more important than money.
Look at the sweating you've done to raise nickels, dimes, quarters... penny contributions.
And if it took their blood, all of their blood, to build it, then so be it.
It's taken you many years to find your way back home.
